snippet: The discovery of the virus that causes Middle East Respiratory Syndrome in a camel belonging to a recent human victim adds credence to the theory that the virus originates in bats but can reach humans through camels.
abstract: Saudi Arabia's Health Ministry announces that the virus that causes Middle East Respiratory Syndrome, an often-lethal lung disease related to SARS, has been found in a pet camel belonging to a recent human victim; discovery adds credence to the prevailing theory that the virus originates in bats but usually reaches humans through camels.
lead_paragraph: The discovery of the virus that causes Middle East Respiratory Syndrome in a camel belonging to a recent human victim adds credence to the theory that the virus originates in bats but can reach humans through camels.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia: MERS Virus Found in Patient’s Pet Camel
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia: MERS Virus Is Found In Patient’s Pet Camel, Ministry Says
